bboxes.raw_text:
ASHEBORO, N.C.--Two white
men, repeatedly Ku Klux Klan
members and armed with pistol,
have been arrested at the scene
of a sit-in demonstration being
conducted here by local units OF
the National Association for the
Advancement of Colored People.


They we're seized outside the
Little Castle newsstand and lunch
counter where seven Negroes
we're protesting the establish
ment's discriminatory practices.
The two we're charged with carry
ing a concealed weapon. inter-
fering with police officers and
attempting to incite riot. They
we're held in lieu of ST. 900 bond
each in the Randolph County jail.
Trial was set for March IL.


Shortly before their arrest the
two men we're seen distributing
Ku Klux Khan literature In down.
town Asheboro. Also. two OUT
of-county cars loaded with XXX
material we're parked near the
protest target. A white Klans-
mans uniform and hood we're
hanging in one Of the vehicles.


Besides the lunch counter. pro-
tests against racial discrimina-
ton we're conducted at Wal
green's Drug Store and the Caro-
lima Theatre. Fifty-two persons
involved we're arrested. Some
were charged with trespassing:
others with resisting arrest when
officers we're forced to carry
them bodily to a police car and up
a steep flight of stairs to the
county Jail.

WASHINGTON : Pupils OF
Washington schools will receive
lessons from a $50 page curri-
culum guide, "The Negro in
American History" This guide
was prepared for all social stud
les teachers by nine man COM
niittee.


Schools in Detroit are also US
ing a So page booklet on Amer
lean Negro history.

full articles.headline:
z WHITES ARRESTED
IN DISPUTE
